Anthony,

Thanks for the kind words. :)

There is at least one more tutorial coming. I have the HyperNEAT code 
implemented, it's actually very simple. The problem is that even the 
HyperNEAT Tic-Tac-Toe player still sucks, and I was kind of implicitly 
promising a near-optimal player next. It's funny how sometimes simple 
domains turn out to be so difficult. If I don't come up with anything in 
a few days, I'll write it up anyway.

I'd be happy to hear suggestions from the group on better ways to 
coevolve a better player. I've been toying around with dual populations 
where one is O and the other is X, similar to the host-parasite setup I 
posted at the end of part 2, but no luck so far. The only other ideas I 
have left are to drastically increase the population size or to add in 
an optimal opponent with random noise like Fogel did originally. I 
hesitate to do the latter though, as coevolution is generally a more 
elegant solution.

Sincerely,
Wesley

Anthony Ison wrote:
>
> Thanks so much for these tutorials Wesley. I for one am eagerly 
> awaiting any more youï¿½re planning to post.
>
> You have a great eye for writing an article that balances conceptual 
> and technical detail.
>
> Love your work!
>
> *From:* Wesley Tansey [mailto:tansey@...]
> *Sent:* Sunday, 25 July 2010 6:43 AM
> *To:* neat@yahoogroups.com
> *Subject:* [neat] Part 2 of SharpNEAT 2 Tutorial
>
> Hi all,
>
> I've just finished part 2 of the tutorial on using SharpNEAT 2 to create
> a Tic-Tac-Toe AI: http://www.nashcoding.com/?p=177
>
> This part covers coevolution, creating custom population evaluators, and
> handling update events. Specifically, I show how to create a parallel
> two-player competitive coevolution evaluator and a hall of fame
> evaluator that you can wrap around other evaluators.
>
> The resulting AI is still not very strong, but it is at least as good as
> the part 1 player. The next tutorial will cover HyperNEAT and
> (hopefully) evolving an optimal player.
>
> Thoughts, comments, and questions are always welcome.
>
> Wesley
>
>
